q_ch: 对于所有Expert Cutters负责的且尚未完成的裁剪任务，共分配了哪些原料，按照裁剪任务进行整理？
q_en: Which materials have been allocated for all cutting tasks that are assigned to Expert Cutters and have not been completed, organized by cutting task?
gt:
Sure thing! Let's dive into the materials allocated for the cutting tasks assigned to the "Expert Cutters" group that haven't been completed yet. Here's a neat table to show you the details:

| Cutting Task ID | Material Name       |
|-----------------|---------------------|
| 8               | Denim Fabric        |
| 11              | Wool, Silk          |
| 16              | Wool, Leather, Down |
| 19              | Cotton Fabric, Synthetic Fiber |
| 20              | Wool, Leather       |
| 21              | Cotton Fabric, Synthetic Fiber |
| 26              | Wool                |
| 27              | Wool, Leather, Down |
| 34              | Cotton Fabric, Synthetic Fiber |

I hope this helps! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. 😊

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM working_group WHERE name = 'Expert Cutters';
steps.description: Retrieve the working group ID for the working group with the name "Expert Cutters"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM cutting_tasks WHERE working_group_id = '4' AND status != 2;
steps.description: Retrieve the cutting task IDs for tasks assigned to "Expert Cutters" that have not been completed

steps.sql: SELECT cma.cutting_task_id, wm.id AS warehouse_material_id, wm.total_number, wm.left_number FROM cutting_material_allocation cma JOIN warehouse_material wm ON cma.warehouse_material_id = wm.id WHERE cma.cutting_task_id IN (8, 11, 16, 19, 20, 21, 26, 27, 34);
steps.description: Retrieve the materials allocated for each cutting task that is not completed

response:
Sure thing! Let's dive into the materials allocated for the cutting tasks assigned to the "Expert Cutters" group that haven't been completed yet. Here's a neat table to show you the details:

| Cutting Task ID | Warehouse Material ID | Total Number | Left Number |
|-----------------|-----------------------|--------------|-------------|
| 8               | 11                    | 4500         | 4500        |
| 11              | 3                     | 4100         | 4100        |
| 11              | 5                     | 1100         | 1100        |
| 16              | 3                     | 4100         | 4100        |
| 16              | 7                     | 2200         | 2200        |
| 16              | 13                    | 1230         | 1230        |
| 19              | 1                     | 3500         | 3500        |
| 19              | 9                     | 2300         | 2300        |
| 20              | 3                     | 4100         | 4100        |
| 20              | 7                     | 2200         | 2200        |
| 21              | 1                     | 3500         | 3500        |
| 21              | 9                     | 2300         | 2300        |
| 26              | 3                     | 4100         | 4100        |
| 27              | 3                     | 4100         | 4100        |
| 27              | 7                     | 2200         | 2200        |
| 27              | 13                    | 1230         | 1230        |
| 34              | 1                     | 3500         | 3500        |
| 34              | 9                     | 2300         | 2300        |

I hope this helps you get a clear picture of the materials allocated! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. 😊
